alert.note: Alert for Allen; Chautauqua; Elk; Labette; Montgomery; Neosho; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 11:58PM CST until December 22 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing drizzle will transition to snow Thursday morning. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 1 PM CST Friday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS..The high winds will create dangerous driving conditions for high profile vehicles. Caution on roadways should be exercised.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Allen; Chautauqua; Elk; Labette; Montgomery; Neosho; Wilson; Woodson
